document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

09E9657152E34EFD936C343A0764186C.description:
Demonstrate increasing independence when considering a word or phrase important to
comprehension or expression.

796F2AABD4634AD996D6741A2851D05C.description:
Accurately use general academic and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing,
speaking, and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

1E1B646AC21D4129AA2CEFD749DB26CB.description: Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

A215D32CF7354A9EA2C764E6D29D4D30.description:
Interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism, oxymoron) in context and analyze their role
in the text.

B7559220D75B4CD4A4B2809D8EF7C5D9.description:
Appropriately identify, interpret, and integrate figurative language, including
personification, similes, and metaphors, into writing and speaking.

CB68CF58D87F457C94DC56B16E475E23.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

FAAF60FF384E4A9B9824A202D85AEEC5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

B0D1DA50512F4083B8083DE47E02571E.description:
Consult both digital and print reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauri) to
find a word’s pronunciation, parts of speech, spelling, origin, and meaning.

A53AD5C044C34E4A925FAC1FAAAE5382.description:
Identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or
parts of speech.

092DB5E4D33D4AECB18C3732B0D48B85.description: Use context clues to help determine meaning.

B97324F3898042C2A6F0616D188E7439.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on appropriately
complex reading and content, choosing flexibly from a variety of strategies.

92000942B5B145279047BC93DB8C241F.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting reference materials.

5FBF4D10942341D98339E0E3A8EEF654.description: Use of comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs.

A26984DF90BE4605811EC7CAD3FDCFBE.description:
Use subject-verb agreement (compound subjects, indefinite pronouns, collective nouns,
inverted word order).

2E7C69FA1BC74119B8BBD3C3B3CF23E3.description:
Use verbals (e.g., infinitives, participles, and gerunds used as adjectives and nouns) and modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, could, shall, should, will, would, must, have to, may, might,
ought to).

57808DF8A6A84E44AEBD1379DC91EE70.description: Use verb tenses (e.g., simple present, present progressive, simple past, past progressive, future, future progressive, and present perfect, including irregular verbs).

29F4E196E0AD4539BD37A2FA969FE276.description: Use verbs in the active and passive voice and in the conditional and subjunctive mood to achieve particular effects.

C5F4CD3DE74B45D08C8D2B6454205369.description:
Apply knowledge of language to understand how it functions in different contexts, to make effective choices in
terms of meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

3F71D30DA44C48EFA50F99ECFD7AD2EF.description: Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and comprehension.

887FE2466D51404E93B684966089441A.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

A8AE460ADAB94DCA9BC61C8ABEB6D9F3.description: Use advanced punctuation marks correctly (e.g., colon, semicolon).

1C2D88EB3BF44C229614DBA649C60F4F.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

A371C09A74AF445481FFED5A223DBA55.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

73D095A3C7884AB6A5E04A04D47AD6C7.description:
Use various types of phrases and clauses to specify meanings and add variety and interest
to writing or presentations.

3DA44F7328A247BA9ECBB8A4873C9E23.description:
Use parallel structure and subject-verb agreement. Apply the understanding of run-on sentences, complex and compound sentences, and sentence fragments. Assess various
grammar and usage texts.

4BE2C38A866C41B58F3E8985F4F3442B.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions when writing and speaking.

69D1093498F34E7E8A9048C98326B8C4.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

896959AD8C474B9B90A880F55E3C3194.description:
Write routinely for short and extended periods of time (e.g., for research, reflection, and revision) for a variety of
discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences (e.g., integrating technology or digital/print resources).

67F976D9BF804CAEB1B41ABB1DE683E4.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

140B8BA63B77402D8F9CF93F33D9DA1D.description:
Improve writing through evidence obtained from analysis, reflection, and research of literary or informational
texts.

5C7E68D57051431F90F8086FA86FCBDD.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

07B0E6BFCAC147DF9A0D83B088CC25D7.description:
As part of a research project, write a report that answer a question or solves a problem, drawing on several
sources and generating additional focused questions that allow for extended exploration and research.

D2E5B33F33794B5D9507906E51B40B86.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

269ECA9C62634DB2ACCD14175F5153CE.description:
Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish different types of writing, present the
relationships between information and ideas efficiently, and interact and collaborate with others.

69836B3F844A4AA8A3097D495F584BEF.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

8849A2717D1F44F0824D54C0307942FA.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, drafting, revising, editing (using editing marks), rewriting, and publishing, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed, avoiding plagiarism,
considering style guides (e.g., MLA and APA student format), and using citations.

78A9A7F03C574014BC4673F7BA5E1D33.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and publishing).

54FBC181E62245BAB53C67FCDCD6B3C4.description:
Write literary texts using transitional words and other cohesive devices to better organize writing and develop real or imagined experiences or events. Use literary elements and techniques (e.g., narrative structure, theme, mood, plot, setting, moral, alliteration, hyperbole, allegory) in 5 or more paragraphs of 6 or more sentences
each.

9CEFD7BAF60F4B779DCE275772AA296F.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

68049D27AF0F431185DF28C574694446.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

CCE4EB29A7664963A05BD7691D3F6380.description: Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

9BD8725A06AD4A49962DDD56020152D6.description: Introduce a topic or thesis statement. Organize ideas, concepts, and information.

CD2912B919A14743866363768F325E15.description: Write informational and argumentative texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of content through essays, letters, and other types of texts in 5 or more paragraphs of 6 or more sentences each.

BDC2230793D84B14996B156248863912.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

D6FBA0E979CC4B39BDAF4EA3E2B019A4.description: Use reliable sources to demonstrate understanding of the topic or text.

A0F1AA8CB3BA4D6BA42F20416EC697FF.description: Support claim(s) or counterarguments with logical reasoning and relevant evidence.

6A9EFBD0282841ACBD054E3CC0D22DDF.description: Interpret, clarify, and defend viewpoints and opinions. Be able to state or justify arguments with support of the thesis statement and claims.

71ADA7F755DF471FB4EC3069CADCDE79.description:
Justify opinions and positions using valid reasoning and sufficient evidence by writing in 5 paragraphs or more of
6 or more sentences each.

31E9D91FB78041429E1C905BCB9378F2.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

51253EAB1BF24958A96F76BBE1690E5E.description:
Read and comprehend a variety of literature (e.g., stories, dramas, and poetry) and informational texts (e.g.,
history, social studies, science, and technical texts) of appropriate complexity.

302BDDA718C94B75B0D6BD0596B8DBD7.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

22E91B7296CE4D6487E77FA907E706B6.description:
Recognize and interpret seminal or literary documents of historical significance (e.g., “Letter from Birmingham Jail” by Martin Luther King, poetry by Julia de Burgos), including how they
address related themes and concepts.

9B93A6A5FDC741658D8E2B291750B816.description:
Analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work (e.g., how
Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author draws on a play by Shakespeare).

F97CA593801F4D5ABCB17505EC30112F.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

F78CFB8DA99545579DFB915DD60A6F31.description: Identify false statements and fallacious reasoning. This includes, but is not limited to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities.

1A9A39A8DFCC4FA097385C9DC6EE4FB4.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient.

BCB54047FE344BC9A85C97371F92EBED.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

E92A8ACEA6A94B88AAA55F1EFD011268.description: Analyze the representation of a topic, character, or key scene as presented in 2 different media (print and multimedia), determining which elements are emphasized or absent in each case.

150EF9752C6947E5AA770849D32D1BBA.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

46F490FD1D1349BE9A536EFA2BADAC55.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in an informational text and identify the use of rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose.

2E31F3F2CD2B43D69D1173112C163073.description: Relate to a particular point of view or cultural experience reflected in a work of literature from outside of Puerto Rico, drawing on a wide reading of world literature.

38D11510CBC34685B1DDE682DE23E04F.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

AA375980DD8A42C39ADC9E9D9984C1F6.description:
Analyze in detail how an author’s ideas or claims (positions) are developed and refined by sentences, paragraphs, or portions of an available informational text (e.g., essays, reports,
and news articles).

EA832553A4454D66B28F986BD69160F5.description: Analyze how an author’s choices about the structure of a literary text or the order of events within it (e.g., parallel plots) creates effects such as mystery, tension, or surprise.

CD7043DBF6B744F68F6A05568AB88ACB.description: Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections, chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

9FD8377EDD204F099657E24F151D8DDE.description: Analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language of a court opinion differs from that of a newspaper).

7B6CF986FD1246D8ACD080F0BC6319A2.description: Determine figurative and connotative meanings in an informational text.

6BDE06ABFDB74F5E9123F6EA5E24C7F4.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in an informational text.

2169F6FFF13A4AEEA480DCB768F08AE8.description:
Analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how
the language evokes a sense of time and place or how it sets a formal or informal tone).

9530C665A9774912B2AEE2306344B7CD.description: Determine figurative and connotative meanings in a literary text.

CA2958B3DB784809A05FAA37BDE82558.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a literary text.

374B957305024FCF97BB49C8305896D3.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze
how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

915E112128104FC392317ADFFC9642CC.description:
Analyze how an author unfolds an analysis or series of ideas or events in an informational text, including the order in which the points are made, how they are introduced and
developed, and the connections that are drawn between them.

B6E4C600B80E42419373FDFCB82781D7.description:
Analyze how complex characters (e.g., those with multiple or conflicting motivations) develop over the course of a literary text, interact with other characters, and advance the
plot and its components or develop the theme.

CBA34BD9AF8540C092E11643FB20726E.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

BFE9790721D34B33A7D7243718FF1567.description:
Determine the theme or main idea of an informational text and analyze its development in detail over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by
specific details. Provide an objective summary of the text.

6F4C807AAF894DFDBBFC9571C33395C1.description:
Determine the theme or main idea of a literary text and analyze its development in detail, including how it emerges in the text and is shaped and refined by specific details. Provide a
subjective or responsive summary of the text.

317E9E39232B48FA80C4A8B8B0A5ABFD.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

51C673BA66914128B5942D1396338E5C.description: Explain inferences and conclusions drawn from texts to support analysis.

06B9F8762E574FFDB3C2B137BECE6EBB.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

02E78AFD94894C2389F4663A570FF8D1.description:
Evaluate, analyze, research/synthesize drawn from in-depth critical reading of appropriate texts and viewing of multimedia resources. Interpret increasingly complex phenomena, ideas, processes, genres, and relationships
within and across texts.

FFB353C1C8BF4F0E83B88BAE8CA82197.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

A3FDBDBC9D1143E4A740058C47FAA52E.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

4F6B1112CFEC4DB7A2D445BBA04D7A37.description:
Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate purpose, intonation, expression,
and understanding.

D44035337455480DA284C934CDF242F1.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

CDC517A1A2774B5C892A807E7099EB46.description:
Accurately and automatically read grade-level texts with appropriate patterns of stress, intonation, or
expression.

AE6320167C774A02930572876A830F86.description:
Process encoding sounds through letters (s,r), consonant blends (sh, sk), digraphs (ay, ew),
or trigraphs (sch, thr) using conventional spelling patterns to form words.

1019225E2B8C4EB588DE9C5BB6DC1CF4.description: Apply meaning to single units of sound in existing word parts to encode a given word.

4B6D708B7E164447ABB0512BC57A221B.description:
Accurately read multisyllabic words using a combined knowledge of all letter-sound
correspondences, syllabication patterns, prefixes, and suffixes.

902C469690DA4155A81D175B487F5FA2.description:
Use a combined knowledge of strategies to encode grade-level monosyllabic and
multisyllabic words.

B984DEAB84C44D27A95EBF1D3B8908A9.description: Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode and encode words.

398F92C93E664A1DB89802145A90EB84.description: Refer to previous grades as needed to reinforce these skills.

EB85C836B5B14E25B2EBC90679400797.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

BFD2FA6138214B31BA338BCB74C60601.description:
Produce complete complex and compound sentences, recognizing and correcting
inappropriate run-ons and fragments.

14B6E52D11BE4049ACA7ECD4105C85FA.description:
Understand that ideas are connected through cohesive devices and larger meaningful
chunks of text.

27244A1C93494E7A97D9B7CE24E86614.description:
Provide complex reference information of source(s) applying required MLA and APA student
format.

0CCA322615204EEE976CE4462AAA8174.description:
Cite or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

8AB6874A32524BD5BD30016D05D6919F.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources to assess the credibility
of each source.

E35FEFE851454C74B679E96E78F002E3.description: Recognize relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

8547006DDCE643F399DF536F30E9247C.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

70DC27D122FD488F8425294B4DA92B55.description: Plan and deliver a variety of oral presentations and reports on developmentally appropriate topics that present evidence and facts to support ideas using a growing understanding of formal and informal registers (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

CAF31E17E2604B598341AF34154A71AB.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

1F860AEA5C354AFC9B531D9BC40D334C.description:
Make predictions and inferences and draw conclusions from listening to a variety of texts,
performances, and multimedia sources.

D50FC3E70C7F463A975220307EAE4CF8.description:
Express thoughts and opinions when discussing current events, concepts, themes,
characters, plot, and conflict resolution.

4D2CE583A36F431F91981FFC7D775C91.description:
Demonstrate ability to adjust language choices by predicting, making inferences, and expressing thought and
opinion according to the context, purpose, task, and audience.

6F47BC8647944E0C8E6F4CEDD17A4182.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

BE3646E0DAA244CF8227B2E4C13993E1.description:
Explain and defend opinions and subtle differences in viewpoints from peers, texts, and
others.

86CFEFB6214F4D18A9D6C6685485F107.description:
Appropriately use an extended number of learned phrases and/or creative or original
responses.

7A2207C6480B4E0CBE75B4DD219721CD.description: Persuade others in conversations using a growing number of learned phrases and open responses to express and defend different opinions.

025777D24FB84F1D9CD849DA3419AA3B.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

A79B7C0BD04442BBB846D04A0BB6231D.description:
Accurately and appropriately use a variety of grade‐appropriate and content‐specific social, academic, college,
and career-ready words when giving speeches and presentations/performances to explain and analyze stories and personal experiences with current/world events.

F259055442BC4DF0A3CD4974306CB775.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

2CC99B418A2B4C53B45F077D7A8FF5E7.description:
Critically analyze closed- and open-ended questions and answer them with increasing
knowledge.

EB976506E55F447EBF453F069DDF0064.description: Explain, restate, discuss, and revise information.

3DE1A714EB2844E9B5956F02B35D5C50.description: Listen to, discuss, evaluate, and respond to complex instructions and information.

A008E0D0421F44419249E22E65B67126.description: Respond orally to closed- and open-ended questions.

E0C0158D26334B5A818F1A3A0573593A.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

D11AEC364A5748E0833F4C20E632AFC4.description:
Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions. Sustain conversations on a variety of appropriate and
relevant academic, social, college, and career topics by following turn‐taking rules and asking and answering on‐
topic questions. React to others with relevant information by paraphrasing, evaluating, analyzing, and
synthesizing ideas.

9E6F745A9135461ABE3E218887D24E8B.description: Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different audiences.

AFBF6BB26960428CA88F0BAC1F18ACC1.description:
Listen to a variety of literature, genres (plays, poetry, and others), and styles to analyze
character development, setting, tone, voice, and mood and make connections to text.

C1106EEA6FD840A9BD8E48EEC2DD1F23.description: Listen to, respond to, react to, and analyze complex instructions and statements. Apply, clarify, and provide instructions and directions.

2ECCCD90359F47A2B1EBE94FDFD8DC85.description:
Take turns and show consideration by concurring or affirming with others, adding relevant
information, and paraphrasing key ideas. Extend ideas or arguments with minimal support.

4084F76F0D59438A8C0F1C36A7A1AF3F.description:
Ask relevant questions that elicit elaboration. Respond to others’ questions and comments
with relevant observations that keep the discussion on topic.

4564E55FFA9D4BB39D8757EF8110828D.description:
Listen, support discussions, and interact with peers during read-alouds (of fictional and informational texts); oral
presentations; and class, group, and partner discussions on a variety of grade‐appropriate academic, social,
college, and career topics.

73A521FC221C494BA6B14227E1BD55DA.description: Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic, college, and career topics.
